result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 7/22/17.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civiljudgment.
Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete:  a cognitive  thinking behavioral modification program and a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic J Thomas-Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 07-22-2014, SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 2014CF001999 (36 Pages).

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Syovata K. Edari.  Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Shanti H.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/22/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/22/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-6 month drivers license suspension
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Syovata K. Edari.  Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defense Sentencing Memorandum received and filed. sab
Clerk spoke with Atty. Edari and agreed to accept this case for a global resolution with the pending Branch 15 case. sab

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Syovata K Edari.  Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has a pending felony case in Branch 15.  Parties are here to discuss transferring this case as part of a global resolution to Branch 15.  This court does not object if accepted by Branch 15.  Defense permanently withdraws defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence Unlawfully Obtained.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Filed by the State:  Response to Defense Motion to Suppress.  alp
MOTION AND MEMORANDUM TO SUPPRESS EVIDENCE UNLAWFULLY OBTAINED, FILED BY ATTORNEY SYOYATA K. EDARI

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Syovata K Edari.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Edari for attorney Shelton.  Trial date vacated.  Justice Point violation addressed; defendant admonished regarding compliance with conditions of bail.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Syovata K Edari via telephone.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Elise Josephson .  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Defendant is informed that he should bring contact information for AODA treatment to next court date. Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial on 4/18/2014 in Branch 26.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Jury Trial and Final Pretrial Hearing in Branch 26. COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Jury trial scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for Danielle L. Shelton.  Paul Hauer for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/24/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dominic J Thomas-Davis not in court.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #14-034

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2-19-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
